1.1.1 The health facility management shall ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.
Facility has a valid licence or is gazetted to offer healthcare services (MOV- Gazette notice /licence)
The facility is licensed for provision of laboratory, radiology and other relevant services (MOV- relevant licenses)
1.1.2 The facility shall have in place governance structures in line with relevant legislation (10)

Facility has a management unit constituted as per legislation (MOV-In Public facilities- Gazette notice, list of board membersIn Private facilities- letters of appointment for board members, list of board members)
Facility management unit has terms of reference(MOV- TORs available)
1.1.3 The health facility leadership shall identify and plan for the services it offers
Facility has a strategic plan/ business plan (MOV-availability of current plan)
Annual work plan with a budget (MOV-availability of current plan)
Departmental work plans in place (MOV-availability of current plan)
1.1.4 The health facility management shall commit to the implementation of the Kenya Quality Model for Health (KQMH) (9)
Management allocates resources for implementation of quality improvement initiatives (MOV- report on capacity development of staff on KQMH, budget, staffing)
Mission and vision statements are aligned to the county/National health sector"'"s mission and vision (MOV- confirm alignment with Kenya Health Policy)
1.1.5 The health facility management shall formally create a designated quality improvement team (QIT).
Quality improvement team appointed with terms of reference (MOV- HR records)
QIT coordinator appointed with terms of reference (MOV-HR records)
The Quality Improvement Team (QIT) meets at least once every quarter. (MOV-minutes)
All Work Improvement Teams (WITs) meet monthly (MOV-minutes)
1.1.6 The health facility shall comply with ethical principles.
Documented procedure for administrative consent for undertaking of health interventions and research (MOV-Documented procedure)
Documented procedure for monitoring adverse effect of health interventions and research (MOV-Documented procedure)
1.2.1 Management shall continually review the facility operations
Facility management team meets on a monthly basis (MOV- Minutes)
Quality management review meetings are held on a quarterly basis. (MOV-Minutes)

Clear quality improvement agenda for the meetings (to include among others results of self-assessment; Customer satisfaction feedback; Process performance; Status of preventive and corrective actions; Risk management; Follow-up actions from previous management reviews; Recommendations for improvement)(MOV-Minutes for management review meetings)
1.2.2 Management shall support staff to engage in a continuous quality improvement process.
Areas for improvement are identified through biannual quality assessments (MOV- report on identified areas for improvement).
Facility Implementation of quality improvement plans (MOV- reports on quality improvement projects)
1.2.3 The facility shall carry out regular quality review and assessment of the effectiveness of its quality improvement initiatives
Self-assessment carried out biannually (MOV- assessment reports)
1.2.4 The facility shall evaluate benefits of improvement interventions at least once annually and success stories and lessons learnt communicated
The facility evaluates benefits of improvement interventions at least once annually (MOV- evaluation report)
The facility disseminates success stories and lessons learnt at least once annually. (MOV- minutes/report of dissemination meetings/ brochures/ social media/ internet links )
1.3.1 The facility has put in place measures to reduce or eliminate clinical risks
The facility conducts risk assessment for all clinical services (MOV- risk assessment report)
The facility has put in place measures to mitigate the identified risks (MOV- mitigation plan/report)
